info.name: Detox Dopamine API
info.description:
Complete API collection for the Detox Dopamine backend application.

## Overview
This collection contains all endpoints for the Detox Dopamine app, a digital wellness application that helps users manage their dopamine habits through task management, journaling, and progress tracking.

## Authentication
Most endpoints require JWT authentication. Use the Login or Register endpoint first to obtain tokens, which will be automatically saved to environment variables.

## Base URL
Default: `http://localhost:8000`

## Quick Start
1. Set up the environment variables
2. Call Register or Login to get authentication tokens
3. Use other endpoints with automatic Bearer token authentication

item.name: Authentication
item.description:
User authentication endpoints including registration, login, logout, and token refresh.

## Token Flow
1. Register or Login to receive access and refresh tokens
2. Access token expires in 24 hours
3. Use refresh token endpoint to get new access token
4. Refresh token expires in 30 days

request.description:
Register a new user account.

## Request Body
- `email` (required): Valid email address
- `password` (required): Minimum 8 characters with complexity requirements
- `full_name` (optional): User's display name
- `timezone` (optional): IANA timezone string, defaults to UTC

## Response
Returns user info, subscription details (starts as FREE tier), and authentication tokens.

response.name: Success - User Created
Error - Email Already Exists

request.description:
Authenticate user with email and password.

## Request Body
- `email` (required): Registered email address
- `password` (required): User's password

## Response
Returns user info, current subscription details, and fresh authentication tokens.

## Auto-save
Tokens are automatically saved to collection variables for use in subsequent requests.

response.name: Success - Login
Error - Invalid Credentials

request.description:
Logout the current user.

## Note
This is a client-side logout. The server does not maintain token blacklists. Clients should discard tokens after calling this endpoint.

response.name: Success - Logged Out

request.description:
Get a new access token using a valid refresh token.

## Request Body
- `refresh_token` (required): Valid refresh token from login/register

## Response
Returns a new access token. The refresh token may also be rotated.

## Token Expiration
- Access token: 24 hours
- Refresh token: 30 days

response.name: Success - Token Refreshed
Error - Invalid Refresh Token

item.name: User Tasks (v2)
item.description:
HomeScreen-facing task endpoints with user-scoped paths.

These v2 endpoints use `/api/v1/users/{userId}/tasks` paths and return data structured for the HomeScreen (priority card, later tasks, day summaries).

## Task Categories
- `WORK`, `PERSONAL`, `HEALTH`, `LEARNING`, `OTHER`

## Task Priority
- `high`: Priority card (only one per day)
- `medium` / `low`: Later task list

## Task Status
- `pending`, `in_progress`, `completed`, `skipped`

query.description: ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today if omitted.

request.description:
Fetch all tasks the user has planned for a given date (defaults to today).

Returns structured data for the HomeScreen:
- `hasTasks` toggle between empty and planned states
- `priorityTask` (the single high-priority task, or null)
- `laterTasks` (medium / low priority tasks)
- `daySummaries` (day-selector pill data for the last 7 days)

Create multiple tasks at once for the "Plan My Day" flow.

- `date` (optional): ISO date, defaults to today
- `tasks` (required): Array of 1-20 task items

item.name: Journal
item.description:
Journal entry endpoints for creating reflections, tracking moods, and viewing insights.

## Mood Ratings
- `GREAT` (5): Feeling excellent
- `GOOD` (4): Feeling positive
- `CALM` (3): Feeling neutral/peaceful
- `STRESSED` (2): Feeling pressured
- `OVERWHELMED` (1): Feeling very stressed

request.description:
Create a new text-based journal entry.

## Request Body
- `date` (required): Entry date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- `entry_text` (required): Journal content
- `mood_rating` (optional): GREAT, GOOD, CALM, STRESSED, or OVERWHELMED

## Free Tier Limit
Free users are limited to 10 journal entries per month.
